ing.item: Tart cooking apples such as pippins or granny smiths

directions.step:
From: daughtry@qualcomm.com ("Vicki C. Daughtry")
Date: Mon, 19 Sep 1994 23:00:00 +0000
This is a low-fat version I just made last night. Use 5-6 pounds of tart cooking apples such as pippins or Granny Smiths. Put 1/2 cup fresh lemon juice in a large pot. (Not an aluminum one.) Quarter, peel, and core apples. Put in pot. Cover. Cook on very low heat, stirring occasionally, for 1 hour (until apples turn to mush). You can use a potato masher on them if you want smooth applesauce. You can also stir in 1/3 to 1/2 cup sugar at the end if you want it sweet. That's it.
